Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure CLI
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Azure CLI to create an ExpressRoute Direct circuit. This involves specifying the subscription, resource group, SKU family, SKU tier, bandwidth, and location.

Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure Portal
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Azure portal to create an ExpressRoute Direct resource. This involves selecting the subscription, resource group, region, and configuring peering location, bandwidth, and encapsulation.
Generate the LOA for the ExpressRoute Direct resource using the Azure CLI. This document is necessary for provisioning the physical connection.
Enable or disable the administrative state of the primary and secondary links for the ExpressRoute Direct resource using the Azure CLI.
Monitor and track the provisioned and utilized bandwidth for the ExpressRoute Direct circuits to ensure optimal usage and compliance with limits.
Follow the workflow to set up ExpressRoute Direct, including creating the resource, configuring circuits, and establishing connections.

Ensure all prerequisites are met before setting up ExpressRoute Direct, including reviewing the ExpressRoute FAQ, finding a connectivity provider, and understanding routing, NAT, and QoS requirements.
Set up routing for the ExpressRoute circuit, including configuring BGP sessions and ensuring proper route advertisement.
Link a virtual network (VNet) to the ExpressRoute circuit to enable private connectivity between on-premises networks and Azure VNets.
Assess and document the network security requirements for the ExpressRoute Direct setup, including virtual networks, firewalls, and threat protection measures.
